Posts.Content: Sep 12, 2007 07:15AM GreenHeron wrote: Hi: Hospice is not giving up, or a substitute for care from you.  Hospice care is very empowering and allows for care that is not stressful for you or your mom.  My dad went through hospice (at the guidance from the head of the ICU...a different circumstance) and it was the best decision all around.  I am very much a fan.  My friends' mom is moving to hospice now with advanced stage pancreatic cancer, and it is also a positive experience....one in Fla and one in MA.  I hope this makes you more comfortable...Good luck to you... Flashdif

Posts.Content: Sep 28, 2007 06:39PM GreenHeron wrote: Sweetheart, slow down and breathe. You are not your mother.  Lots of us have genetic predispositions.  I  do have a nasty bc gene (with no family history as warning!) and my boys made it through the treatment stuff.  There are moms here who will help with that - dealing with your kids - here as well.  One day at a time.  You are strong, I can tell, you are just at one of the hardest parts.  It is like a runaway train because you don't know the extent and are not yet fighting back.  After surgery, after pathology report, you will have a battle plan and will feel more in control.  For now, we are with you in spirit and send wishes for health, peace, and strength! Flashdif
